Founded in 1972 by Seymour Cray, the company developed some of the world's fastest supercomputers used for scientific research, weather modeling, and complex simulations. Cray's systems were known for their innovative parallel processing architectures and vector processing capabilities. The company went through several ownership changes before being acquired by Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) in 2019 for $1.3 billion, continuing its legacy in exascale computing.

name: Smartsheet
description: Smartsheet is a cloud-based platform for work management and automation. Founded in 2005, Smartsheet provides a familiar spreadsheet-like interface combined with powerful project management, collaboration, and workflow automation capabilities. The platform helps teams plan, capture, manage, automate, and report on work across the enterprise. Smartsheet serves various industries and use cases, from simple project tracking to complex work management scenarios, and integrates with popular business applications to create a comprehensive work ecosystem.

name: Bungie
description: Bungie is an independent video game development studio known for creating iconic gaming franchises. Founded in 1991, Bungie developed the Marathon series, Myth series, and most notably the Halo franchise while owned by Microsoft. After becoming independent in 2007, Bungie created the Destiny franchise, a shared-world shooter that combines elements of role-playing games with competitive multiplayer. The company is recognized for innovative gameplay mechanics, compelling storytelling, and building passionate gaming communities around their titles.

name: Valve Corporation
description: Valve Corporation is a video game developer and digital distribution company. Founded in 1996 by former Microsoft employees, Valve created the critically acclaimed Half-Life series, Portal series, and Team Fortress games. The company revolutionized PC gaming with Steam, a digital distribution platform launched in 2003 that became the dominant marketplace for PC games. Valve also developed the Source game engine and hardware like the Steam Deck handheld gaming device, maintaining a significant influence on the gaming industry.

name: Big Fish Games
description: Big Fish Games is a casual video game developer and publisher founded in 2002. The company specializes in downloadable casual games across various genres including hidden object, time management, puzzle, and adventure games. Big Fish Games operates a digital distribution platform offering thousands of games for PC, Mac, and mobile devices. Known for high-quality, family-friendly gaming experiences, the company has published popular series like Mystery Case Files and has expanded into mobile gaming and free-to-play titles.

name: PopCap Games
description: PopCap Games is a casual video game developer best known for creating addictive and accessible puzzle games. Founded in 2000, PopCap developed iconic franchises including Bejeweled, Plants vs. Zombies, Peggle, and Zuma. The company pioneered the casual gaming market with simple yet engaging gameplay mechanics that appealed to broad audiences. Electronic Arts acquired PopCap in 2011 for $1.3 billion, and the studio continues to develop mobile and casual games under the EA umbrella.

name: Nintendo of America
description: Nintendo of America (NOA) is the American subsidiary of Japanese video game company Nintendo. Established in 1980, NOA is responsible for marketing, sales, and distribution of Nintendo products in North America. The company played a crucial role in revitalizing the video game industry after the 1983 crash with the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). NOA continues to localize and promote Nintendo's gaming hardware and software, including the Switch console and franchises like Mario, Zelda, and Pokémon.

name: Getty Images
description: Getty Images is a global visual content company that supplies stock photos, editorial photography, video, and music to businesses, media organizations, and individuals. Founded in 1995, Getty Images maintains one of the world's largest collections of creative and editorial imagery, serving customers in over 100 countries. The company provides content for advertising, marketing, corporate communications, and media publications. Getty Images has evolved to offer AI-powered search and licensing solutions while maintaining high-quality standards for visual content.

name: Auth0
description: Auth0 is an identity management platform that provides authentication and authorization services for applications and APIs. Founded in 2013, Auth0 offers developers tools to implement secure login systems, single sign-on (SSO), multi-factor authentication, and user management features. The platform serves businesses of all sizes, from startups to enterprises, helping them secure their applications and improve user experience. Okta acquired Auth0 in 2021 for $6.5 billion, integrating it into their identity and access management ecosystem.

name: Moz
description: Moz is a software company that provides search engine optimization (SEO) tools and resources. Founded in 2004 by Rand Fishkin, Moz develops tools for keyword research, link building, site audits, and rank tracking to help businesses improve their search engine visibility. The company also offers educational content, industry reports, and community resources for SEO professionals. Moz's products include Moz Pro, Moz Local, and various free SEO tools that have become industry standards for digital marketing professionals.

name: Amazon Fresh
description: Amazon Fresh is Amazon's grocery delivery service and chain of physical grocery stores. Initially launched in 2007 as a delivery-only service in Seattle, it evolved into a chain of cashierless supermarkets in 2020. Amazon Fresh stores feature advanced technology including Amazon Dash Carts for streamlined shopping and Just Walk Out technology. The service offers fresh produce, meat, seafood, and Amazon-branded products, serving as a subsidiary of Amazon focused on revolutionizing grocery shopping through technology integration.

name: Bluesky
description: Bluesky is a decentralized social media platform that operates as a microblogging service similar to Twitter. Founded in 2021 and spun out from Twitter's research initiative, Bluesky is built on the AT Protocol, an open communication protocol for distributed social networks. The platform features algorithmic choice, custom feeds, and user-managed moderation. Bluesky emphasizes user control and composability, offering features like domain-based handles for verification and starter packs for community building. The company is structured as a benefit corporation focused on developing open social internet technologies.
